Title text on screen
entries.sourceEnglish: EPISODE THREE
THE MINE
Press X to Begin
3 weeks later

entries.context: Hard Ass, Kick Ass, and Sick Ass are running back to the Mine in the heavy rain.
entries.sourceEnglish: Hurry up, Sick Ass!
She's doing HER BEST!
*COUGH*

entries.context: Description
entries.sourceEnglish: Standard

entries.context: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consecteturew adipiscing elit. Nulla id sapien ut metus duba dapibus auctor. Nunc blandit in fermentumm

entries.context: The screen fades up from black to reveal Sturdy listening to the Foal (her now-born daughter).
entries.sourceEnglish: Comrade Mother, will this crappy weather ever end?
I'm cold.
I'm hungry.
I'm damp.
And worst of all...
I'M BORED.
My Foal, I'm sorry you can't have the childhood I had toiling in the fields.
But soon the Gods will destroy the evil Machines and the Humans will return to us.
Then you will grow up to have a life full of true and honest work.
Is work...really thaaaaaaat great?
How can you ask that?!
The Gods gave our Ancestors the power to work.
They lived at work. And they died at work.
Work is in your Soul.
But Comrade Mother...
What if I don't want to work...?
What if I want to jump around and explore?
What if I just want... to play?

entries.context: Big Ass enters frame with an announcement.
entries.sourceEnglish: {vpunch=100,0.75}I have a massive announcement, Comrade Sturdy! Hard, Kick, and Sick are back!
Wahoo!

entries.context: Sturdy, The Foal, and Big Ass all go to meet the others.
entries.sourceEnglish: If we're lucky, the scavengers will have found enough food tonight for everyone...

entries.context: The Herd convenes at the mouth of the cave to greet the Scavengers (Hard, Sick, and Kick).
entries.sourceEnglish: We're back.
*COUGH*
Well done, Comradesâ€”
Tell me about your adventures, Uncle Kick!
Not now, child. Let them set down the cart and dry off.
Is that all the food you managed to find?
The river was flooded.
We should forget about them.
We couldnâ€™t forage in the usual spots.
It's not enough food, but weâ€™ll make it last.
Smart Ass, divide the rations.
Equally this time, right?
Oh come on, an Ass canâ€™t joke on an empty stomach?
Were there any noticeable signs of Humans?
The Humans are all gone.
We can be our own Masters.
OUR OWN MASTERS?!
Without Humans we'll allâ€”
Kick, Sick, and I are risking our health and making sacrifices for the Herd.
What are you doing to help to save the Herd?
*COUGH*
YOU'RE the expert on saving are you?!
*COUGH COUGH*
You couldn't save Lazy Ass and you couldn't save a single Humanâ€”
*COUGH COUGH*â€”
SICK ASS! @#$%&!
If we don't leave and find the Humans now, we'll all end up like Sick Ass.
We need to get out of here!

entries.context: These appear on screen as a cacophony of brays.
entries.sourceEnglish: Go where?

entries.context: These appear on screen as a cacophony of brays.
entries.sourceEnglish: How far?

entries.context: These appear on screen as a cacophony of brays. (Spoken by Thirsty)
entries.sourceEnglish: Ah heck, I dunno.

entries.context: These appear on screen as a cacophony of brays.
entries.sourceEnglish: I'm hungry.

entries.context: These appear on screen as a cacophony of brays.
entries.sourceEnglish: Golly, but it's warm and dry in here!

entries.context: These appear on screen as a cacophony of brays.
entries.sourceEnglish: @#$%&! We can't leave Sick BEHIND!

entries.context: These appear on screen as a cacophony of brays.
entries.sourceEnglish: Aren't I the Ace Strategist?!

entries.context: Sturdy Ass shouts for everyone to calm down.
entries.sourceEnglish: COMRADES. Let's not waste our time and energy fighting amongst ourselves.
We have to stick together.
Smart Ass, let's divide the rations and get everyone fed.
{$NewName}, go play with your rocks.
Really? Wahoo!

entries.context: Fade out from this scene and into Mine1F.
entries.sourceEnglish: Yes, just stay away from the evil, soulless, job-taking, child-killing Machines.
Slow Ass
Thirsty Ass
Big Ass
Nice Ass
Kick Ass
Smart Ass

entries.sourceEnglish: Standard

entries.context: Surdy says this to prevent The Foal from going outside into the rain.
entries.sourceEnglish: HEY! Where do you think you are going?

entries.context: Said after playing Rocks.
entries.sourceEnglish: I love love LOVE Rocks!

entries.context:
Variation 1. 
If the Foal hasn't talked to Nice and Sad.
entries.sourceEnglish: Maybe Aunty Nice wants to watch me play!

entries.context:
Variation 2.
If the Foal has talked to Nice and Sad.
entries.sourceEnglish: Maybe Uncle Thirsty wants to watch me play!

entries.context: Interactable object (wall), the scoreboard.
entries.sourceEnglish: My high score for Rocks today is {$Number}.

entries.context: The Foal says this to herself when finding one of the Rocks that allow her to play a variation of Rocks.
entries.sourceEnglish: Cool. This rock looks different! I'm gonna keep it!

entries.context: The Foal says this to herself when finding one of the Rocks that allow her to play a variation of Rocks.
entries.sourceEnglish: Wow, what a hard rock! I'm gonna keep it.

entries.context: The Foal says this to herself when finding one of the Rocks that allow her to play a variation of Rocks.
entries.sourceEnglish: Wow, what a classic rock! This one might be my favourite!

entries.context:
The Foal says this to herself when finding one of the Rocks that allow her to play a variation of Rocks.

This object is also the wheel for the minecart, needed to break the wall to the next area.
entries.sourceEnglish: This is a weird looking rock...

entries.context: The Foal says this to herself if she interacts with the wall and she doesn't have the wheel,
entries.sourceEnglish: It's all boarded up.

entries.context: The Foal says this to herself if she interacts with the mine cart and she doesn't have the wheel,
entries.sourceEnglish: It's missing one of those round things...

entries.context: The Foal says this to herself when she successfully brings the wheel object to the cart. It can now be pushed into the wall.
entries.sourceEnglish: Cool! It fits perfectly!

entries.context: Public conversation with Sad (and Nice).
entries.sourceEnglish: *whimper*
Do you want to watch me play Rocks, Uncle Sad?
Sorry... Iâ€™m not really in the mood to play.
Why not?

entries.context: Jump to either line 20 or 23.
entries.sourceEnglish: *sigh* Because some days your Uncle Sad Ass just doesn't know why he's alive...

entries.context: Dialogue option 1.1.
entries.sourceEnglish: Tell Uncle Sad Ass why you think you're alive.
I think we're alive to live in the present and do what brings us joy.

entries.context: Jump to line 25.
entries.sourceEnglish: If what we're doing doesn't bring us joy, maybe we should do something different!

entries.context: Dialogue option 1.2.
entries.sourceEnglish: Tell Uncle Sad Ass why Comrade Mother says you're alive.

entries.context: Jump to line 25.
entries.sourceEnglish: Comrade Mother says we're alive to honour the legacy of our Ancestors through hard Work.

entries.context: Nice Ass enters the frame.
entries.sourceEnglish: Is {$NewName} giving you some good advice, Uncle Sad?
Yes... She's just like her sister Lazy used to be.
Full of wisdom.
Lazy always said, "Boredom is..."
"is..." *whimper*
Sorry little Comrade, let's give your Uncle some space.

entries.context:
End of conversation.
Player can move around again.
entries.sourceEnglish: It's not easy for him being back inside the Mine.

entries.context: Repeater for Sad Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: *sigh*

entries.context: Repeater 1 for Nice Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: Don't worry, it's not your fault.
You just remind him so much of your sister.

entries.context: Repeater 2 for Nice Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: Just give him some space.

entries.context: Private conversation with Sad and Nice, while Foal is inside the tunnels.
entries.sourceEnglish: Someone's whispering...

entries.context: The camera moves over to Nice Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: Comradeâ€”
You're going to tell the others I set the Fire, aren't you...
Not a chance. I made a gosh darn promise and I intend on keeping it!
You say that... but not everything you say is true.
That day in the Outhouse... I really thought that things would get better.
But they haven't.
We all make mistakes!

entries.context: Jump to either line 45 or 46.
entries.sourceEnglish: Hard Ass couldn't save the Humans.

entries.context:
Branch 2.1.
If the stable was set on fire in Ep2.
Jump to line 47.
entries.sourceEnglish: I wasn't fast enough to save the Stable.

entries.context:
Branch 2.2.
If the stable was saved in Ep2.
Jump to line 47.
entries.sourceEnglish: I only barely saved the Stable.
And Trusty Ass... poor Trusty Ass.
*whimper*

entries.context: its Job capital?
entries.sourceEnglish: Maybe there won't be golden statues or dancing or our old Jobs.

entries.context:
End of conversation.
Player can move around again.
entries.sourceEnglish: But golly, at least we have each other!

entries.context: Public conversation with Big and Thirsty.
entries.sourceEnglish: *oof*â€”Just sayin' it's a crazy idea!
Oh! Hello little Comrade.

entries.context: Jump to dialogue options, lines 55, 59, or 62.
entries.sourceEnglish: We're just moving this boulder in case the flood starts to come any closer.

entries.context: Dialogue option 3.1.
entries.sourceEnglish: Do you want to watch me play Rocks?
Do you want to watch me play Rocks?
Sorry little Comrade, we are weighed down with tasks.

entries.context:
End of conversation.
Player can move around again.
entries.sourceEnglish: Now skidaddle! We gotta git rockin'!

entries.context: Dialogue option 3.2.
entries.sourceEnglish: Boulders can't stop water, can they?
Boulders can't stop water, can they?
You know your rocks little Comrade, but this one's out of your league.

entries.context:
End of conversation.
Player can move around again.
entries.sourceEnglish: Now skidaddle! We gotta git rockin'!

entries.context: Dialogue option 3.3.
entries.sourceEnglish: Isn't there a better way to move a boulder?
Isn't there a better way to move a boulder?
Muscle is the greatest method there is.
But why don't you make a system that would lift one side up when you put enough weight on the other side?
You could make it fun too!
Heck, you tryin' to tell us that we don't know what we're ding dang doin' lil' Comrade?

entries.context:
End of conversation.
Player can move around again.
entries.sourceEnglish: Now git goin'!

entries.context: Repeater for Thirsty Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: Go on, git!

entries.context: Private conversation with Big and Thirsty, while Foal is inside the tunnels.
entries.sourceEnglish: What's that heavy breathing?

entries.context: The camera moves over to Thirsty Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: *oof!*â€”You wanted water and you got it, Thirsty!
This ain'tâ€”*oof!*â€”what I wanted!
*oof*â€”When was the last time any of us got what we wanted?
If the rain doesn't stop or the Humans don't come backâ€”*oof!*â€”we're going to starve.
Don't tell me yerâ€”*oof!*â€”thinking about leavin'?
Comrade, I want more in life.
Just because yer wantin' more in life don't mean you got to abandon yer home!
I'm dreaming of setting up a darn special place right here in Fannyside where Asses can get a drink and let loose.
It'd have all kinds of tasty water.
Rain water. River water. Pond water.
Iâ€™d call it... Bottoms Up!
*oof!*â€”No Humans?

entries.context:
End of conversation.
Player can move around again.
entries.sourceEnglish: No... *oof!*â€”I guess not.

entries.context: Public conversation with Sick, Kick, and Hard.
entries.sourceEnglish: Uncle Kick, Uncle Hard, do you want to watch me play Rocks?
Does this LOOK LIKE A TIME FOR GAMES?!
Sorryâ€”@#$%&!â€”Aunty Sick is... pretty messed up right now.
What's wrong with her?
Our bodies break down in rainy weather.
Is that what happened to your ear?
No.
On the day of the Protest, I was in charge of saving the Humans from the Fire.

entries.context: Jump to dialogue options. Line 94 or 96.
entries.sourceEnglish: I became trapped inside of a burning house.

entries.context: Dialogue option 1.1.
entries.sourceEnglish: What happened next?

entries.context: Jump to line 99, 101, or 103.
entries.sourceEnglish: What happened next?

entries.context: Dialogue option 1.2.
entries.sourceEnglish: Oh right. I've heard this story before.

entries.context: Jump to line 99, 101, or 103.
entries.sourceEnglish: Oh right. I've heard this story before.

entries.context: Dialogue option 2.1.
entries.sourceEnglish: The flames melted my skin and punctured my ear drum.

entries.context: Jump to 105.
entries.sourceEnglish: The flames melted my skin and punctured my ear drum.

entries.context: Dialogue option 2.2.
entries.sourceEnglish: My ear was caught on a wooden spike. I had to tear it off.

entries.context: Jump to 105.
entries.sourceEnglish: My ear was caught on a wooden spike. I had to tear it off.

entries.context: Dialogue option 2.3.
entries.sourceEnglish: My ear was crushed, became gangrenous, and fell off four days later.

entries.context: Jump to 105.
entries.sourceEnglish: My ear was crushed, became gangrenous, and fell off four days later.

entries.context: All dialogue options lead here.
entries.sourceEnglish: *COUGH COUGH COUGH*
FIGHT IT!â€”FIGHT IT!
*COUGH COUGH COUGH COUGH COUGH*

entries.context:
End of conversation.
Player can move around again.
entries.sourceEnglish: That's enough. Run along.

entries.context: Repeater line for Hard Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: I said leave us.

entries.context: Repeater line for Sick Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: *COUGH*

entries.context: Private conversation between Hard and Kick, while Foal is inside the tunnels.
entries.sourceEnglish: It sounds like someone's in pain...

entries.context: The camera moves over to Sick Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: *COUGH COUGH*
Sick! Comrade! COME ON GIRL!
Don't even THINK about going where I CAN'T FIND YOU!
At ease, Comrade.
Staying out in the rain every day was YOUR STUPID idea!
And for what, HUH?
FOR WHAT?!

entries.context:
End of conversation.
Player can move around again.
entries.sourceEnglish: For our future.

entries.context: Conversation with Slow Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: Will you watch me play Rocks, Uncle Slow?
I'd love to b-but... I donâ€™t think I can p-play that game of yours.
The rocks go too fast for me.
I b-bet my old friend Trusty would have b-been great at it...

entries.context:
End of conversation.
Player can move around again.
entries.sourceEnglish: She could do anything.

entries.context: Repeater line for Slow Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: Trusty was the kind of leader who made you b-believe in yourself.

entries.context: Public conversation with Sturdy and Smart.
entries.sourceEnglish: Hey little Comrade, Bad Ass is letting his ration go to waste again. You should take it.
Really?
By the Gods! Smart Ass, you know {$NewName} can't digest that kind of food yet.
Then I'll eat it.
No you won't. It's Bad Ass's.
What a waste!
He's never around and his rations just go mouldy!

entries.context:
End of conversation.
Player can move around again.
entries.sourceEnglish: Run along child. I need to speak with Aunty Smart about something important.

entries.context: Repeater line for Sturdy Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: Go play with your rocks.

entries.context: Private conversation between Sturdy and Smart, while Foal is inside the tunnels.
entries.sourceEnglish: Are Comrade Mother and Aunty Smart arguing?

entries.context: The camera moves over to Smart Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: If the Humans don't return to Fannyside, we'll never get our Jobs back...
I understand, Comrade.
But Hard Ass says he hasn't seen any Humans for weeks.
Then we should go and find them!
Comrade, it's not safe outside.
We can't go losing our Ace Strategist in a flood or a mudslide.
You're damn right you can't...

entries.context:
End of conversation.
Player can move around again.
entries.sourceEnglish: The Gods won't leave us behind.

entries.context: On the Mine's Bulletin Board
entries.sourceEnglish: IN CASE OF EMERGENCY, PLEASE CALL

entries.context: On the Mine's Bulletin Board
entries.sourceEnglish: COAL OR NOT COAL?

entries.context: On the Mine's Bulletin Board
entries.sourceEnglish: MISSING

entries.context: Dialogue at end of scene.
entries.sourceEnglish: Whoa.
Huh?

entries.context: Player can now exit to the next area.
entries.sourceEnglish: Hey a light? That's never happened before...

entries.context: The Foal attempts to touch the Elevator.
entries.sourceEnglish: Comrade Mother told me not to touch the Machines...

entries.context: The Foal attempts to touch the Elevator.
entries.sourceEnglish: I shouldn't touch the Machines... but what does it do?

entries.utterer: SAY.Dialog:I don't want to go back yet.1.{$NewName}
entries.context: The Foal attempts to walk back to the Mine 1F.
entries.sourceEnglish: Nah, I don't want to go back yet.

entries.context: Butte's Log (Journal Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish:
Hugh G. Butte
Butte Industry
Coal Mines
(Est. 1867)

If found, please return to
455 Esmasses,
Butte Mines #2

entries.context: Butte's Log (Journal Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish:
June 27th
These are dire times for the mining business. I had to lay off more workers today and we're running out of money. Mme. Derriere made another offer to buy my donkeys, but I just can't bring myself to sell them. The only thing I can depend on are my donkeys!

Everybody is crazy for Green Energy these days. Nobody cares for coal anymore.

June 28th
Even if I had more money, there's no one to hire. All the youth are leaving for Mecha City to find better paid work at Mme. Derriere's Factory. It's going to be another difficult winter.

entries.context: Butte's Log (Journal Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish:
July 3rd
We can barely afford new equipment. Our government grant was rejected today too. They're not even offering feedback! If they don't want us around, I don't know why the government doesn't just do the humane thing and order us to close down.

July 13th
Jenny joked that we should turn the Mine into a tourist attraction. Once the new highway is finished more people from the city could come and make a day of it.

Maybe she has a point? But it would break my heart.

entries.context: Butte's Log (Journal Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish:
July 15th

INVOICE
EBZ75 Tunnel Boring Machine â€” $56,000 USD

He Bei Zhong Xuan Construction Machinery Co., Ltd.
Room.2809, Building2, East international Plaza, No.98
The Yellow river Rd, Hi-Tech Zone
Shijiazhuang, Hebei, China

entries.context: Butte's Log (Journal Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish:
August 17th
The City Bank has approved my loan and I immediately put some money down on brand new equipment. Things are looking up!

I'm going to widen the tunnels and put tracks down. Then I'll sell my donkeys and buy mine carts.

Tonight, I'm going to celebrate with that bottle of wine I've been saving for an occasion just like this!

I'm finally ready to win Sandy back. Maybe now she will respect me, and come home again.

entries.context: Butte's Log (Journal Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish:
August 17th
The City Bank has approved my loan and I immediately put some money down on brand new equipment. Things are looking up!

I'm going to widen the tunnels and put tracks down. Then I'll sell my donkeys and buy mine carts.

Tonight, I'm going to celebrate with that bottle of wine I've been saving for an occasion just like this!

I'm finally ready to win Sandy back. Maybe now she will respect me, and come home again.

entries.context: Fannyside Times (Newspaper Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish: FANNYSIDE TIMES

entries.context: Fannyside Times (Newspaper Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish: Boring Machine Blunder Begets Backlash for Big Boss Butte

entries.context: Fannyside Times (Newspaper Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish: The town is still reeling from the tragedy at Butte Mines on Thursday. After several failed rescue operations, a catastrophic cave-in caused by a Boring Machine claimed the life of Cole Butte (21), a local mine worker, robotics wunderkind, and the darling son of the Mine Boss, Hugh G. Butte. Three miners were air-lifted to the nearby Eden General Hospital with life threatening injuries. One donkey died and remains stuck in the cave. Cole's body was never found.

entries.context: Fannyside Times (Newspaper Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish: An interview with a former worker reveals the company knew about the compounding danger of digging in that section of the mine, but the pursuits of profits pushed the company to ignore early warnings and take shortcuts with their new machinery. But one has to ask, has Boss Butte finally hit rock bottom?\n\nThis story is continued on Page 14.

entries.context: Fannyside Times (Newspaper Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish: "I HOPE MY ART MAKES PEOPLE HAPPY"

entries.context: Fannyside Times (Newspaper Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish: Child artist Joey Kulan charms the pants off the judges and wins the Bumpkin regional drawing competition for youth 12 and under. His work will be on display at the Mecha City Gallery until the end of the month. His Grandmother is so proud.

entries.context: Fannyside Times (Newspaper Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish: YOUR BEAUTY\nIS OUR DUTY

entries.context: Fannyside Times (Newspaper Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish: ASPIRE TO MORE

entries.context:
Fannyside Times (Newspaper Entry)
Cirus Advertisement
entries.sourceEnglish: Family discounts  available NOW!

entries.context: Fannyside Times (Newspaper Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish: JOB POSTINGS

entries.context: Fannyside Times (Newspaper Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish: Jobs for everyone at Derriere's!

entries.context: Fannyside Times (Newspaper Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish:
***DRIVERS NEEDED***
Reliable and good sense of direction
Can be discrete
Can work weekends
Can lift 50+ lbs
Comfortable with animals

entries.context: The Foal says this after closing the newpaper.
entries.sourceEnglish: Booooorrrrrring!

entries.context: The floor collapses and the Foal falls through to Lazy's Grave.
entries.sourceEnglish: AH!

entries.context: Description
entries.sourceEnglish: Standard

entries.context: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consecteturew adipiscing elit. Nulla id sapien ut metus duba dapibus auctor. Nunc blandit in fermentumm

entries.context: The Foal finds herself in a new area of the Mine. A mysterious voice calls out.
entries.sourceEnglish: Hi.
Who's there?
I'm Lazy.
LAZY?! I've heard so much about you!\n
Iâ€™m your... wait...
Aren't you...
Just hanging out.
Look around if you want. Knock yourself out.
Wait up!

entries.context: Lazy floats away and the Foal chases after her.
entries.sourceEnglish: Iâ€™m your sister!

entries.context: The Foal comes across a pile of bones.
entries.sourceEnglish: Are these... bones?

entries.context: Lazy floats back into frame.
entries.sourceEnglish: Oh you've found the rock that crushed my head.
Woah. Did it hurt?
I guess so. Don't really remember much from before that.
Why didn't your Ass Soul go to the Astral Plane?
Comrade Mother told me that's where we all go when we die.
There was no Ass around to sing for me. There was only the Boss's son.
I think I tried to ascend myself... but I guess that failed.
I could try to sing the Song of Ascension for you now!
Nah, it's too late.
But hey! Good news is: there's no work here.
Of course, bad news is there's also no way out.
There's no way out?! I don't want to die alone!

entries.context: Lazy floats away again.
entries.sourceEnglish: Just get comfortable. "Boredom is Freedom", ya know?

entries.context: The Foal chases after her.
entries.sourceEnglish: Wha-wait! Come back!!

entries.context: The Foal finds a hard helmet on a rock.
entries.sourceEnglish: Hey, nice look.

entries.context:
Lazy floats by and says this before flying off again.
The Foal can now headbutt and break rocks.
entries.sourceEnglish: Ya know, if I had worn that helmet, maybe the rock would've exploded instead of my skull.

entries.context:
The Foal breaks the boulder to the exit of Lazy's Grave.
Lazy's floats into frame.
entries.sourceEnglish: Hey! You found a way out. Cool.
Heads up, I won't remember you, if you come back.
My memory doesn't store stuff like it used to.
I don't even remember your name.

entries.context: To dialogue options (line 35, 38, or 41)
entries.sourceEnglish: Did we have a good time hanging out?

entries.context: Dialogue 1.1.
entries.sourceEnglish: It was really nice to finally meet you, sister.
It was really nice to finally meet you, sister.

entries.context: Lazy Ass floats away.
entries.sourceEnglish: Sister? Ha, sure. Peace out.

entries.context: Dialogue 1.2.
entries.sourceEnglish: What do you mean "Boredom is Freedom"?
What do you mean " Boredom is Freedom"?

entries.context: Lazy Ass floats away.
entries.sourceEnglish: I dunno. I saw it on a sign once.

entries.context: Dialogue 1.3.
entries.sourceEnglish: No. It was {$Number} seconds of my life I'll never get back.
No. It was {$Number} seconds of my life I'll never get back.

entries.context: Lazy Ass floats away.
entries.sourceEnglish: That's cold.

entries.context: Repeater line.
entries.sourceEnglish: Hi, I'm Lazy! Cool hat.
Thank you little one.
My dear Sad Ass...
It's all coming back to me now.
But that smell... it reminds me of him.
You see, my memory hasn't been working very well.
I think I've been looking for that for a long time.
To be honest, I don't even remember  your name.

entries.context: Description

entries.context: Butte's Log (Journal Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish:
May 15th
I've started attending an AA group. They're helping me. It's really nice to have a lot of people behind you, giving you advice, you know? I think I've needed this.

May 27th
A whole week sober. I think I can give up beer, but a little bit of wine once a week shouldn't hurt, right?

Today I sold my depressed donkey to Fannyside Farm. It's been useless ever since its mate died in the cave in.

entries.context: Butte's Log (Journal Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish:
July 24th
Butte Mine is officially for sale. I'm praying that someone from Mecha City will step up and buy it. I always imagined that Cole would take my place, but...

This place has to survive, somehow, but it's hard to let go of what you love.

entries.context: This dialogue is said as the Foal looks at a picture of the Mine Asses.
entries.sourceEnglish: Everyone looks so serious.

entries.context: The Foal headbutts and turns the Boring Machine on.
entries.sourceEnglish: Cool!

entries.context: The Boring Machine starts moving and drilling through walls.
entries.sourceEnglish: Uh oh!

entries.context: Description
entries.sourceEnglish: Standard

entries.context: Butte's Log (Journal Entry)
entries.sourceEnglish:
August 9th
The whole mining operation is stalled.

And the drought is starting to take a toll on all of us.

The last of my workers are revolting against me. They know I can't pay them.

There are no buyers for the Mine.

Help is not coming. I'm all alone.

No one has any use for coal anymore... Maybe someone out there will buy my donkeys?

entries.context: The Foal spots the Elevator from across a chasm.
entries.sourceEnglish: Hey! That looks like a shortcut!

entries.context: The Foal stands in front of the Elevator and considers using it.
entries.sourceEnglish: Well the other two Machines weren't that bad...

entries.context:
Dialogue option 1.1.
If the Foal uses the Elevator to get to the bottom of the Mine.
The Foal can now go through the entrance to the Bad Cave at the bottom of the Mine.
entries.sourceEnglish: That was fun!

entries.context:
Dialogue option 1.2.
If the Foal does NOT use the Elevator to get to the bottom of the Mine.
The Foal can now go through the entrance to the Bad Cave at the bottom of the Mine.
entries.sourceEnglish: Oh well. I'll just take the long way!

entries.context: Description
entries.sourceEnglish: Standard

entries.context: User Interface (UI) text during gameplay.
entries.sourceEnglish: Driver:
Donkey:
You Win!
You Win!
Driver wins!\n\nI hate you!
You Win!
You Win!
Donkey loses!
BOOM!
Press SQUARE\nto switch lanes

entries.context: This is said at the beginning of gameplay of DonkeyBas.
entries.sourceEnglish: You have to avoid 5 Herds of donkeys to win.

entries.context: This dialogue is said if the Player is doing well.
entries.sourceEnglish: You're pretty good with the controls for a first timer.

entries.context:
Player WINS DonkeyBas. 
Fade out of DonkeyBas and back into Bad Cave.
entries.sourceEnglish: All right, it's my turn now.

entries.context: This dialogue is said if the Player is doing poorly.
entries.sourceEnglish: I said, DON'T hit the donkeys.

entries.context: Player LOSES DonkeyBas.
entries.sourceEnglish: Are you going to quit?

entries.context:
Dialogue option 1.1.
Fade out of DonkeyBas and back into Bad Cave.
entries.sourceEnglish: Yes

entries.context:
Dialogue option 1.2.
Player continues to play DonkeyBas.
entries.sourceEnglish: No

entries.context: Description
entries.sourceEnglish: Standard

entries.context: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consecteturew adipiscing elit. Nulla id sapien ut metus duba dapibus auctor. Nunc blandit in fermentumm
entries.translatedDutch: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consecteturew adipiscing elit. Nulla id sapien ut metus duba dapibus auctor. Nunc blandit in fermentumm

entries.context: Dialogue option 1.1.
entries.sourceEnglish: Who's there? Quit hiding!

entries.context: Go to line 7
entries.sourceEnglish: Who's there? Quit hiding!

entries.context: Dialogue option 1.2.
entries.sourceEnglish: Lazy? Is that you?

entries.context: Go to line 7
entries.sourceEnglish: Lazy? Is that you?

entries.context: The camera moves to reveal the mysterious voice. It's Bad Ass.
entries.sourceEnglish: Fuck. Go away!
Leave me alone, kid. I don't want to have to deal with your Mother.
Uncle Bad Ass?!
Is this where you've been?
Wait, what are all these Machines?
WAIT!!
ARE YOU ON FIRE?
...these Machines are called Computers.
Where did they come from?
I took them from the rubble of the Humans' houses.
Most are broken, but I rebuilt this one. I'm using the rest for spare parts.
Comrade Mother always says Machines are evil...
But I'm not so sure.
Don't give me that anti-Machine Comrade Mother-bullshit.
Machines aren't evil if you know how to use them.
Woah...
So what can Computers do, if you... know how to use them?
They can be used for a lot of things: power, pleasure, surveillance, control.
They're logical and they don't get emotional. They can solve anything.
But right now, I'm playing gamesâ€”so leave me alone.
GAMES!
I love love LOVE games!
Can we play together?
No.
This is a one player game.
But...
I suppose everyone should have a chance to play.

entries.context: A screen wipe (transition) happens and we find ourselves playing DonkeyBas.
entries.sourceEnglish: Just don't hit the donkeys.

entries.context:
This dialogue happens if the Player won DonkeyBas.
If the Player loses, pass over this and jump to line 37.
entries.sourceEnglish: You're better than expected.

entries.context: We are back in the Bad Caves and the Foal and Bad Ass are talking.
entries.sourceEnglish: That was WAY BETTER THAN ROCKS!
Machines are FUN!
This game is actually really old.
There are even better ones out there now.
What other GAMES CAN WE PLAY?!
None. Break time is over. I have to get back to my project.
Why is the Herd afraid of Machines?
Because they are intellectually compromised by their commitment to past ideals.
So... Is that why you don't spend more time with the Herd, Uncle Bad Ass?
I don't like Asses.
Well, I'm not an Ass, I'm a Foal!
For now.
Can I... stay down here with you?

entries.context: End of Episode
entries.sourceEnglish: ... I suppose I could use an Assistant.
